title: Sensory Friendly Covid Vaccination Clinic
cleaned_text:
The A.J. Drexel Autism Institute is proud to partner with the Academy of Natural Sciences and St. Christopher’s Hospital for Children for a sensory-friendly Covid-19 vaccination clinic on Sunday, July 17th from 9-11 AM.

 Sunray Pharmacy and medical staff from St. Christopher’s will be administering first, second, and booster doses to anyone age 6 months and up. Though walk-ins are welcome, registration for all participating family members is encouraged. You can

 register at our link.

 Families should access the vaccine clinic through the 19th Street entrance of the Academy. Each child receiving the vaccine and one parent will get free entry to the museum, which will open for visitors at 9AM.

 Parkit Express provides a discounted rate for museum visitors at the Logan Square Garage at 1815 Cherry Street. Download the iParkit app from the App Store or Google Play and create an account using program code ACADNMP001 to receive the discount.

 Email AutismInstitute@drexel.edu for further information.

opengraph.title: Sensory Friendly Covid Vaccination Clinic | Autism Speaks
